comment.author: 23492747@N04
comment._content: Nice to see that Health and Safety Regulations were so well developed in Salazar's Portugal - not!  Look at those aviation fuel drums scattered around any old how!  I suppose some old boy just wandered up to each plane that needed refuelling, sucked on a length of tube to get some siphoning action going, spat out whatever amount of kerosene had ended up in his mouth and shoved the end of the tube into the filler hole on the plane until it overflowed - and probably with a lit fag jammed in the corner of his mouth! (joking!)

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Left to Right...CS-ADD Lodestar Aero Portuguesa....D-AAIF DC-3 Lufthansa....Spanish Airline DC-2

comment.author: 78006886@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/74784995@N00] douglas DC3 -220A, D-AAIF was delivered to Ceskoslovenska letecka spolecnost (Czechoslowak airlines) in Prague Ruzyne an roosted in April 1938 by Czechoslowakian Aviation Authority as OK-AIF. The whole fleet of CLS's planes was conficated by Germans in 1939 in Prague. They were rosted in 1939 as D-A (+original czech letternig). . D_AAIF was written off after being destroyed on the ground by air raid in 1943. some picture of its previous livery: www.planes.cz/lite/data/fotografie/OK-AIF.jpg
